Name: Tell me about yourself (1-2 minutes)
Action: Use 3-part arc: Present (current impact), Past (how you got here), Future (why this role). Keep it role-relevant.
Company Hook: Amazon: mention 1 LP you embody; Microsoft: growth mindset; Atlassian: open, team-first; Uber: do the right thing; Google: collaboration and curiosity.
Notes: Keep to 90 seconds; end with a question back (role alignment).
Red Flags to Avoid: Life story; tools dump; no impact signal.
Result: Interviewer gets a crisp narrative that sets up your strongest evidence for the rest of the loop.
Situation: Joined as SWE; quickly became the person owning {area} that impacted {customer/system}.
Task: Summarize trajectory: scope growth, key strengths, why this role now.

Name: Why do you want to work here?
Action: Name 2 concrete reasons: (1) product/mission fit, (2) how your skills map to a team problem; cite a recent initiative or platform focus.
Company Hook: Amazon: tie to customer obsession/ownership; Atlassian: customer + team practices; Microsoft: empowerment mission; Uber: reimagine movement + integrity.
Metrics to Mention: 1 customer outcome + 1 technical area you match
Notes: Use one line that references their published values/principles.
Result: They believe you are intentional and likely to accept.
Situation: You researched product + culture; you see a specific problem space match.

Name: Biggest strength
Action: State strength as behavior, then STAR proof: e.g., 'I turn ambiguous problems into shipped outcomes'.
Company Hook: Amazon: Deliver Results + Bias for Action; Microsoft: learn-it-all; Atlassian: be the change.
Notes: Strength should be relevant to target role.
Result: Clear signal you can repeat the behavior at their scale.
Situation: You were repeatedly trusted with {hard thing} across teams.

Name: Biggest weakness
Action: Name a real but non-fatal weakness; explain system you built to mitigate (checklists, review rituals, mentorship, training).
Company Hook: Microsoft: explicit growth mindset; Amazon: Learn and Be Curious; Google: coachability.
Notes: End with what you will do in next 30 days to keep improving.
Result: Weakness is controlled; growth is observable.
Task: Show you can self-correct without drama.

Name: Tell me about a failure
Action: Explain root cause (process gap), immediate mitigation (rollback/feature flag), and permanent fix (tests, monitoring, runbooks). Share what you learned.
Company Hook: Amazon: Dive Deep + Insist on Highest Standards; Atlassian: blameless learning; Uber: do the right thing.
Notes: Include what you would do differently today.
Situation: A release caused {incident} or a project missed a key requirement.
Task: Own it and show corrective action.

Name: Conflict with a teammate
Action: Separate person from problem; align on shared goal; propose data-driven experiment; document decision; ensure psychological safety.
Company Hook: Atlassian: open company, no bullshit (but caring); Google: collaborative; Microsoft: one Microsoft.
Metrics to Mention: Cycle time; rework reduced; stakeholder clarity
Red Flags to Avoid: 'I was right'; attacking character; vague outcome.
Result: Decision made; relationship strengthened; delivery on track.

Name: Disagree with your manager
Action: Bring data (metrics, risks), offer 2 options with tradeoffs, propose a time-boxed spike, commit to final call.
Company Hook: Amazon: Have Backbone, Disagree and Commit; Microsoft: model-coach-care.
Metrics to Mention: Risk reduced; decision lead time shorter
Notes: Explicitly say 'I disagreed, then committed once decided'.
Result: Better decision with buy-in; manager trusts you more.
Situation: Manager pushed a direction that risked {customer/tech debt}.
Task: Raise concerns respectfully and propose alternatives.

Name: Handling ambiguity
Action: Define success metric, identify constraints, map stakeholders, propose phased plan, validate with quick prototype, then iterate.
Company Hook: Amazon: Dive Deep; Google: structured thinking; Uber: build globally (constraints awareness).
Notes: Show you can move from unknowns to a plan fast.
Situation: You were given a vague goal: 'improve X'.
Task: Turn it into an executable plan.

Name: Leadership without authority
Action: Create shared doc, clarify RACI, run decision meeting, unblock via small PRs, recognize contributors, communicate status.
Company Hook: Google: collaboration; Atlassian: play as a team; Microsoft: one Microsoft.
Notes: Name how you gave credit publicly.
Situation: You needed alignment across teams for {dependency}.
Task: Drive outcome without being the boss.

Name: Why should we hire you?
Action: Give 3 bullets: domain fit, execution proof, collaboration traits; each backed by a metric or story.
Company Hook: Amazon: map to 2-3 LPs; Microsoft: growth + customer obsessed.
Task: Connect your proof to their needs.
